column6: North}}</ref> died aged 157) was the ninth [[Chieftain of the Dúnedain]].

column1: Aravorn succeeded his father, [[Aragost]], when he died in {{TA
column3: n}}. Aravorn's rule seems to be uneventful as the enemy centered a lot of its attacks on the newly-formed [[Rohan]].

column1: Aravorn died in 2654, after having ruled as chieftain for 66 years, and was succeeded by his son, [[Arahad II]].<ref name="North"/>
Aravorn's name is [[Sindarin]], though its exact meaning is unclear. The first element is ''[[aran]]'', "king", but the second could be ''[[boron
column2: born]]'', "steadfast", or ''[[morn]]'', "darkness", which both become ''vorn'' through [[lenition]].
